message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The accumulation of GM2-gangliosides in the neurons suggests Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by a deficiency in the enzyme Hexosaminidase A. None of the other options are associated with Tay-Sachs disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms presented by the child are consistent with GM2-gangliosidosis, specifically Tay-Sachs Disease, which is caused by a deficiency in Hexosaminidase A. Sphingomyelinase deficiency causes Niemann-Pick Disease, ß-galactocerebrosidase deficiency causes Krabbe Disease, and a-L-iduronidase deficiency causes Hurler Syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The accumulation of GM2-gangliosides in neurons suggests Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by the deficiency of Hexosaminidase A enzyme. None of the other options are associated with Tay-Sachs disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of deafness, inability to eat, and paralysis suggest a lysosomal storage disorder, and the presence of GM2-gangliosides suggest a deficiency in hexosaminidase A.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The accumulation of GM2-gangliosides in the neurons indicates Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by a deficiency in hexosaminidase A. None of the other enzyme deficiencies listed cause Tay-Sachs disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described suggest that the child had Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by a deficiency in Hexosaminidase A enzyme. This results in the accumulation of GM2-gangliosides in the neurons, leading to a range of neurological symptoms. Sphingomyelinase deficiency causes Niemann-Pick disease type A and B, ß-galactocerebrosidase deficiency causes Krabbe disease, and a-L-iduronidase deficiency causes Hunter syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described are consistent with Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by a deficiency of Hexosaminidase A enzyme. The accumulation of GM2-gangliosides is a characteristic finding in Tay-Sachs disease. The other options are associated with other lysosomal storage disorders.

Sphingomyelinase deficiency causes Niemann-Pick disease, ß-galactocerebrosidase deficiency causes Krabbe disease, and a-L-iduronidase deficiency causes Hurler syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms described are consistent with Tay-Sachs disease, which is caused by a deficiency in the enzyme Hexosaminidase A. Option A is associated with Niemann-Pick disease type A and B, Option B with Krabbe disease, and Option D with Hurler syndrome.
